text: This is a list of primary aluminium smelters in the world. Primary production is the process by which alumina is smelted to pure aluminum metal. Secondary production is the process of recycling aluminum scrap into aluminum that can be used again. Capacity here refers to metric tonnes of output aluminum. The list is incomplete and missing some data. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Country !Location !Total annual capacity (tonnes) !Ownership !Status |- | || Puerto Madryn || 460,000 || Aluar (Aluminio Argentino) || |- | || Boyne Island || 570,000 || Rio Tinto (Boyne Smelters Limited) || |- | || Tomago || 590,000 || Tomago Aluminium Company Pty.
